You need to find the minimum number of "inversions" in a permutation $q$ of length $n$ that satisfies the following condition:

For any two indices $i$ and $j$ where $1 \le i < j \le n$,  $p_{q_i} \le p_{q_j} + k$.

An inversion in a permutation is a pair of indices $i$ and $j$ where $i < j$ but $a_i > a_j$.
